title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:00): Problem is if you do {{velocity}} then {{html}} velocity isn't highlighted inside the html macro.  
degro - (00:01): ouch  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:01): also {{groovy}} switches it to java highlighting.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:02): If you want a copy, ping me with your email.  
degro - (00:04): p-p-ping  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:04): I meant private message. This chat is logged publicly, you're gonna win the email lottery!  
degro - (00:05): oops.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:06): Oh well, a name that short will get hit just by wordlist guessing.  
degro - (00:07): hah  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:09): I had an idea for an email service. You allow users to have aliases to their email address so when you use bad companies which sell your name (no names here but it's a river in Brazil) you can set up an address for doing business then disable it.  
degro - (00:10): sounds good, but the email service market is overflowing  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:11): True enough. Still spam is a problem. I think companies would like to be able to give a unique address to each user who loads the page.  
degro - (00:12): yeah  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:12): Then we could determine what ip addresses the spam spiders are running on by comparing the email address sent to with the ip that loaded the page.  
degro - (00:15): export/import worked just fine  
anamarias left at 00:16 (Quit: anamarias  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:16): Good. I'm going to do a little more work on my script, should be done soon and you can help test ;) Nice chatting.  
degro - (00:17): Same here, and thanks for the highlighters  
degro left #xwiki at 00:26  
degro joined #xwiki at 00:26  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 01:02  
abusenius left at 01:03 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds  
degro\_ joined #xwiki at 04:27  
degro\_ - (04:27): ping CalebJamesDeLisl  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (04:28): pong  
degro\_ - (04:28): :)  
degro\_ - (04:28): hey, any clue on how to specify multiple start strings for a context in a lang definition file?  
degro\_ - (04:29): eg <start>{{velocity}|{{velocity output="false"}</start>  
degro\_ - (04:29): I bet that doesn't work  
degro\_ - (04:30): or... should I just define another context...  
degro\_ - (04:30): with the same props  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (04:30): I used this a lit http://library.gnome.org/devel/gtksourceview/stable/lang-tutorial.html  
degro\_ - (04:30): thx  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (04:31): Also start gedit from the console. It will dump errors.  
degro\_ - (04:32): you mean errors in the lang file?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (04:32): If regexs work then something like {{velocity[^}]\*}</start>  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (04:32): Yes lang file errors.  
degro\_ - (04:32): yeah, the tutorial says regex works  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (04:33): Cool. I knew it worked for match, was not sure about start/end  
sdumitriu - (04:34): degro\_: It's morning already, go to sleep  
degro\_ - (04:34): nah, no sleep for me tonight  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (04:35): I was thinking that.  
degro\_ - (04:36): got stuffs to finish  
degro\_ - (04:36): and stuffs to start  
degro\_ - (05:24): ping sergiu...  
degro\_ - (05:25): ping sdumitriu...  
jvelociter left at 05:36 (Ping timeout: 252 seconds  
degro\_ - (05:41): hey CalebJamesDeLisl, you still there?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (05:41): Yup.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (05:42): Getting light over there yet? ;)  
degro\_ - (05:42): could you please take a look at some xwiki code of mine? I'm having some paragraphs and breaks out of nowhere  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (05:42): Ok.  
degro\_ - (05:42): and yeah, it's gotten light for an hour or so, it's 6:42am  
degro\_ - (05:42): just a sec, so I can set it up  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (05:47): ping when ready.  
sdumitriu left at 06:52 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
Denis left at 07:04 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds  
degro\_ left at 07:07 (Quit: Leaving  
Denis joined #xwiki at 07:09  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 07:29  
kibahop joined #xwiki at 07:54  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 07:59  
degro left at 08:16 (Quit: degro  
anamarias joined #xwiki at 08:19  
anna\_ joined #xwiki at 08:39  
sburjan joined #xwiki at 08:45  
sburjan\_ joined #xwiki at 09:00  
sburjan left at 09:01 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
sburjan\_ is now known as sburjan ([[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)  
vmassol - (09:20): CalebJamesDeLisl: hi  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:20): Hi.  
vmassol - (09:21): quick question  
vmassol - (09:21): do you think we need to run the register tests from admin + when there's no live validation on all the tests in Register Test to provee that they work?  
vmassol - (09:21): it's just a question of speed  
vmassol - (09:22): (I understand it's safer)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:22): If you stop testing adminAddUser, the lightbox can totally break and nobody will know (it happened.)  
vmassol - (09:22): this is not what I said  
vmassol - (09:23): there are 7 tests in RegisterTest  
vmassol - (09:23): do they all need to run again to prove that the adminadduser work  
vmassol - (09:23): (same question for live validation)  
vmassol - (09:24): or would it be enough to run just 1 for ex?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:24): RegisterTest is with liveValidation on, test without livevalidation is pretty important because it proves there are no security holes.  
vmassol - (09:25): yes yesy  
vmassol - (09:25): I'm not suggesting we remove the notion of testing without livevalidation  
felix1 joined #xwiki at 09:25  
vmassol - (09:25): just wondering if few tests can be executed with the same result  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:25): So you suggest not testing (much) with livevalidation turned on?  
vmassol - (09:25): I'm asking since I haven't fully dived into these tests  
vmassol - (09:26): I'm not suggesting anything yet  
vmassol - (09:26): I'm asking  
vmassol - (09:26): I'm asking the expert in this domain if we're not testing too much  
vmassol - (09:26): :)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:26): Well the way it works is RegisterTest has all of the tests and withoutLivevalidation and AsAdmin extend RegisterTest.  
vmassol - (09:26): I know  
vmassol - (09:26): but that's very easy to modify  
vmassol - (09:27): takes 5 seconds  
vmassol - (09:27): since you can control test by test which runs  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:27): Override tests with nothing?  
vmassol - (09:27): nope  
vmassol - (09:27): using a junit4 annotation  
vmassol - (09:27): that lists which tests to execute  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:27): I see.  
vmassol - (09:29): (not ethat I haven't done it so I don't know exactly)  
vmassol - (09:29): but right now the question is more whether we need to re-run everything or if running less would yield the same confidence  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:29): I hate to remove tests which actually test different things. AdminAddUser uses code in Registration which is usually dormant.  
vmassol - (09:29): can be done with @category: http://kentbeck.github.com/junit/doc/ReleaseNotes4.8.html  
vmassol - (09:30): CalebJamesDeLisl: ok fine we can revisit this when the tests will really take way too long  
vmassol - (09:30): it's not going to be long  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:30): It would be cool if it could choose tests to execute randomly.  
vmassol - (09:30): that's easy to do in junit3  
vmassol - (09:30): not sure how to do in junit4 though  
vmassol - (09:30): actually  
vmassol - (09:30): it's easy to do in junit4  
vmassol - (09:31): using a custom @Rule  
vmassol - (09:31): but let's not go there  
vmassol - (09:31): sounds a bit too magic  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:31): Cool. Seems like the real answer is to add another executor.  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 09:31  
felix1 - (09:32): Hi  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:32): Hi.  
felix1 - (09:32): what are the diff beetwen jsessionid and srid ?  
felix1 - (09:32): i don't understand why i've the both  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:33): I think they belong to the container (tomcat etc.)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:33): Meaning I don't know ;)  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 09:34  
felix1 - (09:34): oki ;)  
arkub joined #xwiki at 09:36  
silviar joined #xwiki at 09:38  
Enygma` joined #xwiki at 09:39  
evalica joined #xwiki at 09:41  
lucaa left at 10:07 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:08): re Register test: I think I can make those tests take ~half the time by stopping using sendKeys  
vmassol - (10:08): CalebJamesDeLisl: but we need that no?  
vmassol - (10:08): to simulate what the user does  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:08): I plan to at some point implement native javascript in FormElement (like selenium1)  
sdumitriu left at 10:08 (Quit: Leaving.  
vmassol - (10:09): CalebJamesDeLisl: not sure what you mean but make sure to post on the webdriver mailing list  
vmassol - (10:09): lots of knowledgable guys there  
vmassol - (10:09): and they may have this done already or preparing it, or...  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:09): I googled about slow sendkeys, someone said it was because it was firing all keydown, key up events.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:10): I think the best thing to do is use FormElement when possible and then we can do all speed hacks in one place.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:13): \* crazy idea: make a screensaver which makes the computer rsync the code and execute tests until it's stopped.  
abusenius joined #xwiki at 10:13  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:14): abusenius: It looks like we're going to have to remove xml escaping of the space copyright. The link to creative commons is getting ruined.  
tmortagne joined #xwiki at 10:15  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 10:17  
kibahop left #xwiki at 10:21  
abusenius - (10:34): CalebJamesDeLisl, ok, I might have been too precautios :)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:35): If the user can edit space preferences, they can use html macros. The major concern is that XWiki syntax can't be run.  
plunden joined #xwiki at 10:39  
abusenius - (10:40): hm, where can I edit this copyright actually?  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 10:40  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:43): Space preferences.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:43): Upper left --> administer space.  
abusenius - (10:44): in my case its only in global administration  
abusenius - (10:45): there is nothing similar in space administration... strange  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:50): Hmm, looks like 5209 isn't quite fixed: http://hudson.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-product-enterprise-tests/com.xpn.xwiki.products$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/880/#showFailuresLink  
vmassol - (10:51): CalebJamesDeLisl: some of these are caused by jv's change of yesterday  
vmassol - (10:51): he introduced a regression a least in the creation of spaces  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:52): I was referring to the escaping test.  
vmassol - (10:52): don't know if his changes account for all problems or only a subset  
vmassol - (10:52): ok  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:52): I had to do some manual merging but I don't think that broke the patch.  
sburjan - (10:59): hello vmassol.  
sburjan - (10:59): do you have 5 minutes, I have a couple of questions  
vmassol - (11:00): sburjan: shoot here and if someone knows he'll anser  
vmassol - (11:00): answer  
sburjan - (11:01): first of all. On a normal xwiki, not a farm, is there any superadmin user (that already exists from the install)  
vmassol - (11:02): sburjan: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Configuration#HEnablesuperadminaccount  
vmassol - (11:02): (so answer is yes)  
sburjan - (11:03): and in this condition, what is the meaning of the superadmin ? when running a normal wiki instalation  
sburjan - (11:03): to recover and hacked/deleted admin account ?  
sburjan - (11:03): \*from a  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:07): Pretty much.  
sburjan - (11:09): I see  
sburjan - (11:10): so if theAdmin user is deleteded by accident/hack, there is still a chance for recovery  
sburjan - (11:10): and the second issue is more like a suggestion  
sburjan - (11:11): have you ever considered to auto-rename all the attaching files, to a lowercare extension ?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:12): Because of the url spec?  
sburjan - (11:12): fo examne .. XWiki sees example.PNG and example.png diffrent. This is because XWiki is case sensitive, but from a user POV, there shouldn't be any diffrence, or at least NOT from the extension perspective  
abusenius - (11:12): CalebJamesDeLisl, I'll look at test failures once I finished merging all my branches  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:12): ^ windows user ;)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:13): Ok.  
abusenius - (11:14): as a linux user I don't see why example.PNG and example.png should be the same file, would totally break my expectations ^\_^  
vmassol - (11:14): sburjan: if there' s no difference between lowercase and uppercase I wonder why both system exist and why we learn how to write using both at school :)  
vmassol - (11:15): try this at schoole: I LOVE xwiki. Your teacher is not going to consider it's the same as "I love xwiki"  
vmassol - (11:15): s/schoole/school/  
vmassol - (11:15): ;)  
vmassol - (11:15): you'll get some negative mark for wrongly using some uppercase where it shouldn't  
vmassol - (11:16): (trying to rationalize it :-P )  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:16): My thinking is we should try to avoid changing the user's input. Maybe an optional filter would work though.  
vmassol - (11:17): more seriously, this is a discussion for the mailing list sburjan in case you want to propose to change the current behavior. We'd need to agree on it.  
vmassol - (11:17): but this raises more questions  
vmassol - (11:17): as to whether MyPage is the same as myPage  
vmassol - (11:17): etc  
vmassol - (11:17): it's a pretty large change  
sburjan - (11:17): as a linux user they are diffrent, but from the perspective of a web user, they shouldn't. basically the only thing I'm suggesting is a windows-style approach over the files' extensions  
vmassol - (11:18): sburjan: it's not consistent  
vmassol - (11:18): I don't see why we would do it for file extension and not space/page names for ex  
sburjan - (11:18): MyPage should be diffrent from myPage, I agree on that  
vmassol - (11:18): then I don't undertsand your point  
vmassol - (11:18): what's your rationale?  
tmortagne left at 11:19 (Quit: Leaving.  
vmassol - (11:19): I think you're maybe mixing a generic use case from a specific use case you'd want to have in your own wiki  
sburjan - (11:19): because when tracking versions of files, PNG and png will be diffrent, and will be catalogued as distinct files, even if the filename(without extension) is the same  
vmassol - (11:20): myattachment.png is diffrent from Myattachment.png  
vmassol - (11:20): extensions are not special  
tmortagne joined #xwiki at 11:20  
vmassol - (11:20): they're not even considered as extensions  
vmassol - (11:20): it's a single string  
sburjan - (11:20): yes, but myattachment.png os diffrent from myattachment.PNG too, and this shouldnt happen (IMO)  
sburjan - (11:20): \*is  
vmassol - (11:21): again what is the logic?  
abusenius - (11:21): sburjan, have you seen matrix? there are no extensions :)  
vmassol - (11:21): abusenius: exactly  
vmassol - (11:21): :)  
tmortagne - (11:21): very important point :)  
vmassol - (11:21): sburjan: from xwiki's POV you can name your attacgment "myattachmentwithnodotinit"  
sburjan - (11:21): yes, that is true...  
vmassol - (11:22): (extensions don't exist as abusenius was saying)  
vmassol - (11:22): (we only have a notion of filename)  
sburjan - (11:22): the only thing I'm saying is that attachment versioning is affected by this.  
sburjan - (11:22): yes... i understand  
vmassol - (11:23): yes different names leads to different attachments  
vmassol - (11:23): s/leads/lead/  
silviar - (11:23): i think what sorin means to say is that when you have Image.png with version 1.0 and you upload Image.PNG, Image.PNG will be uploaded separately also with version 1.0 instead of becoming version 2.0 for Image.png  
vmassol - (11:23): silviar: I understand what sorin says  
sburjan - (11:23): but same name with caiptal extensions leads to diffrent versions  
silviar - (11:23): ok :)  
vmassol - (11:24): Image.png and image.png are also different  
sburjan - (11:24): yes, exactly :P  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 11:24  
mflorea left at 11:24 (Quit: Leaving.  
vmassol - (11:24): and MyPage and mypage are also different pages  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:24): It's an age old question, do we offend powerusers in order to protect newbies from their mistakes?  
vmassol - (11:25): the real problem is that we have a current behavior  
vmassol - (11:25): and changing it across the board would be a huge task  
vmassol - (11:25): breaking lots of things for users  
vmassol - (11:25): so I don't see it happening anytime soon  
vmassol - (11:25): (assuming we wanted to do it)  
tmortagne left at 11:26 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
sburjan - (11:26): it was just a suggestion :P  
anna\_ left at 11:27 (Quit: anna\_  
tmortagne joined #xwiki at 11:27  
vmassol - (11:27): sburjan: if you feel strongly about it you should take it to the devs list and make a proposal  
vmassol - (11:27): (here it's just informal discussion that have no real weight on decisions - all decisions go through the list)  
sburjan - (11:28): I'm not... I still have a lot to learn how XWiki handles these things.  
vmassol - (11:28): and you're free to suggest as many things as you want  
sburjan - (11:29): well, I will suggest things when I have new ideas .. hope I won't get to annoy you  
mariusbutuc joined #xwiki at 11:32  
abusenius - (11:37): CalebJamesDeLisl: re failing escaping tests, seems that you forgot to also apply the changes to skins/colibri/src/main/resources/colibri/menuview.vm  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:38): ahh right. I spent enough time merging them only to commit from /web/  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:38): Sorry for the bother.  
abusenius - (11:40): np  
felix1 - (11:40): I've an error when i change my theme : Failed to execute macro: html org.xwiki.rendering.macro.MacroExecutionException: When using the HTML macro inline, you can only use inline HTML content. Block HTML content (such as tables) cannot be displayed. Try leaving an empty line before and after the HTML macro.  
felix1 - (11:41): But the new theme is dispayed after a refresh  
tmortagne left at 11:59 (Quit: Leaving.  
vmassol - (12:01): anyone remembers why import XWikiPreferences would trigger the reload of components?  
vmassol - (12:02): CalebJamesDeLisl isn't that somerthing you were discussing with degro yesterday?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (12:02): Yes it is.  
tmortagne joined #xwiki at 12:02  
vmassol - (12:05): tmortagne: do you remember why import XWikiPreferences would trigger the reload of components  
vmassol - (12:05): ?  
vmassol - (12:05): I remember it reloads plugins  
vmassol - (12:05): but for components i don't remember  
vmassol - (12:06): and I don't understand why we would do that  
tmortagne - (12:06): vmassol: it does not reload componenents  
tmortagne - (12:06): but some plugins are rehistering event listeners  
vmassol - (12:06): by reload I mean call the annotation loader  
tmortagne - (12:06): s/rehistering/registering/  
vmassol - (12:06): oh ok  
vmassol - (12:06): I see  
tmortagne - (12:07): but you added many if to no re-register listener in most of thoses plugins  
tmortagne - (12:07): s/no/not/  
vmassol - (12:07): I need to check the source  
vmassol - (12:07): I still don't understand why the annotation loader gets called  
tmortagne - (12:08): yep that does not make sense  
tmortagne - (12:08): annotation loader is supposed to be done only when initialising application context  
sburjan - (12:09): Jira issue XSTOUCAN-147 posted  
sburjan - (12:10): cool stuff :)  
vmassol - (12:10): sburjan: meet our xwiki bot!  
sburjan - (12:10): i've met him before, but posting jira issues makes it even cooler :P  
vmassol - (12:12): !help  
vmassol - (12:12): hmm doesn't work  
vmassol - (12:12): :)  
vmassol - (12:12): !news  
tmortagne - (12:13): very impressive, when to write !help you make vmassol talk :)  
vmassol - (12:13): :)  
vmassol - (12:13): !search sburjan  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 12:14  
sburjan - (12:15): yeah, the archives from this channel  
vmassol - (12:15): the whole wiki  
vmassol - (12:15): !search column  
tmortagne - (12:16): it's just that you are tlaking more that you participate to xwiki.org page ;)  
vmassol - (12:16): this is useful when newbie come here  
vmassol - (12:16): for example if they ask: how to enable the superadmin account  
vmassol - (12:16): you reply:  
vmassol - (12:16): !search superadmin  
vmassol - (12:16): hmm deosn't work  
vmassol - (12:16): :)  
vmassol - (12:16): lol  
tmortagne - (12:16): superadmin is not the best example :)  
vmassol - (12:17): yes  
vmassol - (12:17): !search enable superadmin

vmassol - (15:55): silviar:  not sure you know abiout it but we already having a documenting guide  
vmassol - (15:55): you could use it as the base and work on improving it with your new draft  
vmassol - (15:55): silviar: it's avail here: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Contributing#HDocumentation  
vmassol - (15:56): here to be precise: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DocGuide

vmassol - (16:01): ok
